result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari Lee Eckstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Fine of $2,400.00 plus all costs, fees, assessment and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance during Extended Supervision.  Any cash bail posted on this case and 15CF004375 to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence imposed on 15CF004375.

superMiscConds.notes: Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equippted with an ignition interlock device for a period of 36 months.  To commence after the period of revocation has been served.  Pay the ignition surcharge.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed/filed.

Court advised defendant she cannot possess firearms; further advised defendant she cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citiizen deportation is possible.

records.addlTxt: denied, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. jbs
Partial bail refund check packet
File previously scanned.
16A 017392.  Bail from this case and 15CF4375 now applied.
Transfered cash bond from 15CF4375.
16A 017291/reversed
filed by defense counsel as to sentencing.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Robert S., David E., and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  51  months, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 15CF004375; with  7 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  15  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  36  months.  

Court finds defendant  IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and  IS  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
-  Pay a fine of $2,400  PLUS all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Any cash bail posted on this case and Case# 15CF004375 to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
-  Court ordered Alcohol Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
-  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 36 months.
-  Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of  36 months to commence after the period of revocation has been served and pay the ignition interlock surcharge.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Kari Lee Eckstrom in court with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised she cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.
